title: Aligarh Madrasa Teaching Self-Defence To Students Whose Parents Were Killed In Mob Violence
text:
Incidents of mob violence are increasing everyday. Just one day ago, a Muslim couple from Alwar was allegedly beaten up by two men for not chanting ‘Ram-Ram’. Now, a Madrasa in Aligarh is imparting self-defence training to several children who lost their parents in similar incidents of the mob violence.

As many as six children between the ages of six to 12 years, all residents of Alwar, Rajasthan, are being trained in a number of martial arts forms including boxing, kick-boxing, Busho Kai and karate at Chacha Nehru Madrasa.

Representational Image - AFP

"We train boys and girls in the training academy in several martial art forms. We have six children of mob lynching victims who participate very enthusiastically in whatever martial art form we teach them. These kids are very bright," school trainer Azizurrahman said.

According to the school principal Rashid Ali, the children were brought to the academy by a student of Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) who is surveying the condition of the children of mob lynching victims.

"The man went to their homes in Alwar and persuaded their guardians to send them for self-defence training. He brought them to us and we admitted them here. We train them like any other student of the school," he said.

Representational Image - AFP

The main aim is to teach these children is self-defence, the principal said. It is to teach them a sense of confidence and channelise their energy in a positive direction. "We try to help them forget what happened with their fathers and come out of mental trauma through martial arts and music," Ali said.

"I have been learning a martial art for the last one year. It includes Boxing, Kick Boxing, Karate etc. I enjoy very much," one of the children studying in Madarsa, Ikran, said.
